intro: Corydalis mairei var. megalantha, commonly known as the giant Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in well-drained soil. It produces delicate, fern-like leaves and has a compact growth habit. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in its natural habitat.
